--- title: "Week 1" subtitle: "Overview of Multilevel Models" execute: echo: false --- Before you start the materials for week 1, make sure you have reviewed the [syllabus](syllabus.qmd). # Week Learning Objectives By the end of this module, you will be able to - Identify alternative names for multilevel modeling (MLM) - Describe the types of data MLM can handle - Knit a simple R Markdown file ## Task Lists 1. Attend the Tuesday session for course introduction and Q&A 2. Install/Update R and RStudio on your computer 3. Review the resources (lecture videos and slides) 4. Complete the assigned readings * Snijders & Bosker chapters 1 and [2][4] (they're relatively short) * [R Markdown Intro][1] * [Markdown Quick Reference][2] 5. Introduce yourself on the #introduction Slack channel (as part of HW 1) 6. Attend the Thursday session and participate in the class exercise 7. Complete Homework 1 [1]: https://vimeo.com/178485416 [2]: https://web.mit.edu/r/current/RStudio/resources/markdown_help.html [4]: https://us.sagepub.com/sites/default/files/upm-assets/44075_book_item_44075.pdf # Lecture ## Slides ## Multilevel Data Structure ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-note icon=false} ## Check your learning How would you describe the data structure in the video?

::: ## Name and History ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-note icon=false} ## Check your learning What is another name for multilevel modeling?



::: ## Usage of MLM ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-tip appearance="simple"} Another example that relates to ecological fallacies is the ["happiness paradox"](https://esrc.ukri.org/about-us/50-years-of-esrc/50-achievements/the-easterlin-paradox/) in economics, which says that income is related to happiness in a cross-sectional analysis (i.e., between-person level) but not in a longitudinal/time series analysis (i.e., within-person level). ::: ::: {.callout-note icon=false} ## Check your learning In the data structure where there are multiple measurements for the same person, which level is level 1?

:::
